graphics.color module¶

graphics.color.rgb2hex(r, g, b)[source]¶
graphics.color.hex2rgb(hexcode)[source]¶
graphics.color.gaussian_kernel(sigma)[source]¶

generate 1D Guassian kernel for smoothing sigma: standard deviation, >0

Parameters:sigma (scalar) – Standard deviation of kernel. Kernel size is automatically adjusted to ceil(sigma*2)*2+1 (which is a little small but eh)
Returns:K – normalized Gaussian kernel
Return type:vector
graphics.color.hsv2rgb(h, s, v)[source]¶

h: hue 0 to 360 s: saturation 0 to 1 v: value 0 to 1

graphics.color.lightness(r, g, b, method='lightness')[source]¶
graphics.color.luminance_matrix(method='perceived')[source]¶

Method ‘perceived’ .299*R + .587*G + .114*B Method ‘standard’ .2126*R + .7152*G + .0722*B Method ‘lightness’ .3*R + .59*G + .11*B

graphics.color.match_luminance(target, color, THRESHOLD=0.01, squared=False, method='perceived')[source]¶

Adjust color to match luminosity of target

Method ‘perceived’ .299*R + .587*G + .114*B Method ‘standard’ .2126*R + .7152*G + .0722*B Method ‘lightness’ .3*R + .59*G + .11*B

graphics.color.rotate(colors, th)[source]¶

Rotate a list of rgb colors by angle theta

Parameters:
  • colors (array-like) – Iterable of (r,g,b) tuples. Rotation does not affect magnitude, but may cause resulting colors to fall outside original colorspace.
  • th (float) – Angle to rotate
Returns:

list – List of hue-rotated (r,g,b) tuples
Return type:

results

Calculates the angular difference in hue between two colors

h: hue c: chroma l: luminosity

graphics.color.circularly_smooth_colormap(cm, s)[source]¶

Smooth a colormap with cirular boundary conditions

s: sigma, standard dev of gaussian smoothing kernel in samples cm: color map, array-like of RGB tuples

graphics.color.radl2rgb(h, l=1.0)[source]¶

Slightly more optimized HSL conversion routine. Saturation fixed at 1

graphics.color.radl2rgbLUT(h, l=1.0)[source]¶

radl2rgb backed with a limited resolution lookup table

graphics.color.complexHLArr2RGB(z)[source]¶

Performs bulk LUT for complex numbers, avoids loops

graphics.color.color_boxplot(bp, COLOR)[source]¶

The Boxplot defaults are awful. This is a little better

graphics.color.hex_pack_BGR(RGB)[source]¶

Packs RGB colors data in hexadecimal BGR format for fast rendering to Javascript canvas. RGB: 256x3 RGB array-like, ..1 values

graphics.color.code_to_16bit(code)[source]¶

Converts a #RRGGBB hex code into a 16-bit packed 565 BRG integer form

graphics.color.bit16_RGB_to_tuple(RGB)[source]¶

Converts 16-bit RRRRR GGGGGG BBBBB into (R,G,B) tuple form

graphics.color.enumerate_fast_colors()[source]¶

Enumerates colors that can be rendered over a 16 bit bus using two identical bytes, skipping the lowest two bits of each byte, and reserving the fourth bit for mask storage. This is intended for development of optimized color pallets for mictrocontroller driven display interfaces.

graphics.color.tuple_to_bit16(c)[source]¶

convert RGB float tuple in 565 bit packed RGB format

graphics.color.tuple_to_bit24(c)[source]¶

convert RGB float tuple in 565 bit packed RGB format

graphics.color.bit16_print_color(c)[source]¶

Convert RGB tuple to 16 bit 565 RGB formt as a binary string literal

graphics.color.show_fast_pallet()[source]¶

Subset of colors that can be shownn quickly on the Arduino UNO using the standard 3.2-inch TFT touch-screen breakout. Restricts colors that can be sent with a single write to one port. 16-bit color mode with low and high bytes identical.

graphics.color.show_complete_fast_pallet()[source]¶
graphics.color.show_complete_fastest_pallet()[source]¶

16 bit RGB 565; but don’t even write the lower byte

graphics.color.show_hex_pallet(colors)[source]¶
